properties.areaDesc: Caribbean Waters of Puerto Rico from 10 NM to 17N; Anegada Passage Southward to 17N
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 14 at 7:58AM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
Doppler radar and satellite images indicated scattered showers
with thunderstorms moving west across the Caribbean offshore
waters. These thunderstorms were moving around 20 knots.
Additional thunderstorms could develop in the next few hours
across the Anegada Passage and Caribbean waters, mainly south of
St. Croix.
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots, locally higher
waves, and lightning strikes. Boaters should seek safe harbor
immediately until this storm passes.

Stay tuned for any additional statements or possible watches or
warnings from your National Weather Service forecast office in San Juan.
